Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001761
Special Investigation Intake Date: September 11, 2024
License #: CI790296492
Licensee Group Organization: Wolverine Human Services
Licensee Designee: Judith Fischer
Chief Administrator: Keisha Taylor
Agency Name: VASSAR HOUSE
Agency Address: 955 COMMERCE DR
VASSAR, MI 48768-8954
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/09/2025
Capacity: 30
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Contact Method Contact Purpose
Date
9/11/2024 Face to Face Special Investigation Initiation;
Interview
9/18/2024 Face to Face Announced Visit; Interview
9/30/2024 Phone Interview
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, a staff member elbowed a youth in the
stomach. The staff member had their elbow in the youth's stomach
and kept pushing.
Investigation Interview:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 11, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth A said she has been placed at Vassar House since April
2024. Youth A said at some point she was standing in unit five and
Staff 1 was standing next to her and put her elbow in Youth A’s
stomach and refused to move. Youth A denied Staff 1 saying
anything to her or attempting to restrain her, rather just kept
pushing her elbow into her stomach. Youth A said she does not
recall when this happened. Youth A said she does not recall which
youth were present when it occurred or if there were other staff
around during this incident. Youth A denied any injury from Staff
1’s elbow, stating Staff 1 was just in her space and it annoyed her.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 18, 2024. Youth B said she has been in unit five with
Youth A for several months. Youth B said she has never seen Staff
1 push her elbow into Youth A stomach. Youth B denied ever
having Staff 1 push her in the stomach or seeing Staff 1 ever put
her elbow into any other youth’s stomach.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 18, 2024. Youth C said she has been in unit five with
Youth A for several months. Youth C said she has never seen Staff
1 push her elbow into Youth A stomach. Youth C denied ever
having Staff 1 push her in the stomach or seeing Staff 1 ever put
her elbow into any other youth’s stomach.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 18, 2024. Staff 1 said she has never placed her elbow
into Youth A’s stomach. Staff 1 said on August 27, 2024, Youth A
was trying to push her back against the door to open it and Staff 1
placed her hand between Youth A’s back and the door to attempt
to get her to stop opening the door.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 18, 2024. Staff 2 said she has worked several of her
shifts with Staff 1 and has never seen Staff 1 push her elbow into
2

Youth A or any other youth. Staff 2 reported she does not have
any concerns with Staff 1’s interactions with Youth A or any other
youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on September 30, 2024.
Staff 3 said he has worked several shifts with Staff 1 and has
never seen her elbow Youth A in the stomach or any other youth.
Staff 3 denied any concerns with Staff 1’s interactions with youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 18, 2024. Supervisor said he has worked with Staff 1
and has supervised her for several years. Supervisor denied ever
seeing Staff 1 pushing her elbow into Youth A’s stomach or any
other youth’s stomach. Supervisor said he has never had
concerns with Staff 1’s interactions with youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file was reviewed. Staff 1 had
disciplinary record in December 2023 for parking in the
wrong lot; February 19, 2024, for failure to pass
medications; April 4, 2024, 3-day suspension and demotion
for a medication passing error.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews there is not enough information to support a rule
violation as Youth B, Youth C, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and
Supervisor all denied Staff 1 pushing her elbow into Youth A’s
stomach. Youth A was not able to identify a date or time therefore
no video was able to be viewed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
_____________________________________October 8, 2024_
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 10, 2024

Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
